label: AB6C2D_mP20_14_a_3e_e_b-001
title: Sr$_{2}$MnTeO$_{6}$ Structure
comments:
This is the ground state structure of the double perovskite Sr$_{2}$MnTeO$_{6}$.  Above 250$^{\circ}$C it transforms into the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB6C2D_mC40_12_ac_gh4i_j_bd-001}{Sr$_{2}$NiTeO$_{6}$ structure}.  Above 550$^{\circ}$C it transforms into the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB6C2D_tI20_87_a_eh_d_b-001}{Sr$_{2}$NiWO$_{6}$ structure}, and above 675$^{\circ}$C it transforms into the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_cP5_221_a_c_b-001}{cubic perovskite $E2_{1}$ structure}. (Ortega-San Martin, 2004). 
 (Ortega-San Martin, 2004) give the structure in the $P2_{1}/n$ setting of space group \#14.  We used findsym to transform this to the standard $P2_{1}/c$ setting, which uses a different set of basis vectors. 
 The ICSD designates Ba$_{2}$LaRuO$_{6}$ (\#100793) as the prototype for this structure.
